application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Approval of Planning Condition 36 (Flood Risk Assessment) of Planning Permission ref: 14/13247/FUL (Erection of new buildings of 4 to 16 storeys in height and part demolition, alterations and change of use of Former Post Office and Former Telephone Exchange listed buildings to provide 2,141 sqm of retail/ cafe/ restaurant uses (A1-A5 use) and 638 sqm of flexible floorspace to be used for either retail/caf√©/restaurant uses (A1-A5) or Office (B1), 931 sqm of Office (B1) floorspace and 253 sqm of community/leisure (D1/D2 use) and 319 residential units. 132 car parking spaces proposed with access from Ashdown Road and 610 cycle parking spaces) dated 25/02/2016
decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate, through the submission of cogent information, that the development would prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that compensatory storage of flood storage is provided, that it ensures safe access and egress from and to the site and that the scheme would reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and future occupants, contrary to Policy DM4 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
